April 11, 195S*
Dr* Burton Paulu
Director of Bedlo and Television
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
With the Columbus meeting coming up, 1 would like to pull to*
gather an agenda for the consideration of the research committee *-
even though 1 will not be able to make it to the meeting this year*
There are a number of issues which need to be discussed and settled,
if possible* Most of these are dependent, in part, upon the financial
situation for the coming years* Is the probability of an increase in
research funds known yet? It seems to me that the committee will be
unable Intelligently to discuss any plans unless they know whether
they are talking about $500.00 worth of plans, $5,000*00 worth,
$50,000.00 worth, or $500,000.00 worth*
tee of the members of the research committee has raised the
question of whether this committee should worry about men who are
possibilities for director of research for the KAEB. It would seem
to me to be futile for anyone to worry about such a thing until we
know whether there is to be money for this position* 1 would think
that we should not ask people to waste time on problems which may
never develop*
One real problem that the committee needs to worry about is a
better definition of the goals of the grants-in-aid program and the
criteria for election of recipients of such grants* This would help
not only the selection committee but those who want to request such
grants* 1 believe that one of the reasons we have not received more
high quality proposals is that our announcements have been too vague.
I also think it would be helpful if we could get the announcement out
three or four months before requests are due* For exaaple, if we
could get the announcement out by the end of September and requests
were due the mad of December, researchers would hsve time to develop
adequate proposals* This would give them time to investigate the
related research, to formulate good hypotheses and sound research
designs* Most of the studies which have been financed up to this
point hsve not been based on any sort of hypotheses or, even more
